texts.description: This file defines the MAM system information that must be localized.

text.description: The Language HTML Meta tag definition. This tag is used by MTMSIX.DLL.
The LCID of the locale that IIS should use. This affects formatting and should match format specified below. Leave blank to not set a LCID and just accept the default.
Chars allowed for a date
Special date format used by JavaScript based calendar widget. See MDM/Common/Widgets/Calendar for more information.
Use 24 hour clock (value=true) or AM/PM based clock (value=false).
End of day
The date format used all across the application. See the Visual Basic Format instructor for more help.
ExtJS date format definition
The time format used all across the application. See the Visual Basic Format instructor for more help.
The time and date format used all accross the application. See the Visual Basic Format instructor for more help.

NOTE: This value must always use the "." character as the decimal separator. Even if the real DECIMAL_SEPARATOR is different. The amount format used all accross the application. See the Visual Basic Format instructor for more help.
The decimal separator. Used by MDM Client Side (JavaScript).
The 1000 separator. Used by MDM Client Side (JavaScript).
Number of digits after the decimal point for decimal. Used by MDM Client Side (JavaScript).
Number of digits before the decimal point for decimal. Used by MDM Client Side (JavaScript).
Define if the day light saving mode must be used when the date are localized.
Define the dates separator.
Define if the day light saving mode must be used when the date are localized.
Define if the day light saving mode must be used when the date are localized.
weekdays.
